Food was decent, but service from the cashier was very poor and combo meal portion sizes/prices are well out of whack with individual items, unless you're hungry for a LOT of basmati rice. Lesson learned: if you go here with a larger appetite, order a la carte, NOT the combo meal.

I ordered the vegetarian combo ($10), which arrived as 4 veggie momos and rice in a box (the rice took up 80% of the container) plus Nepali style veggie chili (more like a bean curry) in a plastic bowl, which filled less than 50% of the container. After witnessing a group that had ordered a similar combo and seeing the portion size of their chili, I asked for a bit more chili, since my portion size looked like it was a mistake/rush job by the server. The cashier quickly said no, because I had ordered the combo. 

When I mentioned the other group, she said they ordered the momos and chili separately, so they got a full bowl of chili. Ordered separately, the total cost of 8 veggie momos and the bowl of chili is $12 (each $6), so I said it will be helpful if they share that information with you when ordering, since I spent nearly the same ($11.90 with my $1 tip) on my less than half portion. 

Although it's not the cashier's job to guess how hungry I am or to explain menu details to each customer without being asked, her attitude and response lacked any sense of customer service, so I will not be coming back.
author: Scott T.

description: My friend introduced me to this place yesterday. Got the chicken and momo combo and it was so good I dreamed about them last night! Extremely filling combo, rich, savory fillings, and really tender chicken. I will definitely be back! (Love the story behind Bini's, too).
author: Janie W.

description: Holy moly - the lamb dumplings were amazing! They looked like Xiao lun bao Chinese soup dumplings on the outside but were filled with tasty lamb meatballs on the inside. There were eight of these morsels for a great price and the chai tea was freshly made and not too sweet. Will definitely stop here again when I'm downtown. Next time, I'll buy some to take home to my family. Located right near the Montgomery Station stop.
author: Susan L.

description: 1st time trying Nepalese food & OMG is this place delicious!! Must try the momos (turkey, chicken or lamb) all delicious. Best way to sample everything is with the combo. Comes with rice, chicken & 4 momos of your choice all for $12. Definitely more than enough food. It's little hole in the wall is simply amazing! Well done.
author: Monika Y.

description: We had the dumplings for breakfast. They were really tasty and came out quick. The meal was very solid, and the ladies were nice
author: Yanir R.

description: Fulfilling and very inexpensive for the location. I liked the sauce and the flavor of the momos, but the skin was a bit too thick. They reminded me of the Chinese soup dumplings without the soup.
author: C J.

description: I was definitely wrong about this place. Slowly, this has actually become my go to place for lunch and I love that you can either just got momo's (if you're not in the mood for something heavy) or you can get a combination of both the momo's and the veggie curry! The orange sauce on top of the momo's is delicious as well! Since this is a small shack looking establishment, there is very few staff, but everyone is extremely nice and the food comes out quickly! This is a great grab-and-go place in fidi!
author: Malika R.

description: Really hits the spot when I have momo craving. Wish they had chicken momo as well, but beggars can't be choosers.
author: Isha M.

description: I have been on the hunt for authentic momos in the city for a long time and I have to say Bini's hits the momo out of the park! I tried the turkey momos and they were AMAZING!!
author: Natalya R.

description: This place was OK. They had the food precooked and they assemble them once you order. It was not as fresh as I would like it to be. The best part of the meal was definitely the curry. The dumplings were tasty but I felt it tasted stale! the rice was lacking in flavor as well.
author: Samantha S.

description: Yes, this is what I was looking for. Authentic dumplings / momos. The service is super cool. And the persons managing it are fantastic. My wishes they grow more and more.
author: Himanshu Shiva A.

description: My husband and I loved finding small hole in the wall Asian eats on our trip to SF. Bini's was awesome and a great price for the location!
author: Shelby F.

description: Loved the Bison Momo addition. Very delicious. Some of the wrappers were a bit tough but that is ok for the space they work in. I thought I was sad when I did not see the lamb but loved the Bison more!
author: Susan M.

description: I tried the food at this cart last week and just loved the complexity of the flavors in their sauce. Dumplings were so moist and flavorful. Fast service, big portion and under $10!! Luckily it is right around the corner from my workplace. Looking forward to eating here again!
author: Rachel A.

description: Delicious food, reasonably priced, and conveniently located. Bini's was my first experience with Himalayan/Nepalese food so I don't know how it compares to others, but it's a winner in my book. Had the chicken + momo combo and it was just the right amount of food, with enough for an afternoon snack. It was like Indian food meets Shanghai cuisine with the curry and dumplings. Also tried the burrito the next day - also delicious but gets messy so have a plate close by. The burrito fed me 2x. Definitely will return.
author: RuthieAnn A.

description: This spot is pretty good. The momos are moist and the turkey meat inside is amazing. Then the tomato cilatro sauce on it adds another level of flavor. I could just drink that sauce! The kwati is pretty good as well, as it has a healthy mix of beans and lentils. The gorkha chicken is very tender n moist w good chicken curry flavors. This spot is convienient and usually pretty quick.
author: Pavan C.

description:
Got the vegetarian combo: 4 veggie momos with tomato sauce, kwati, and rice. 

Momos: 3.5/5 I wish they had a tad more filling and spice. I've never had momos, so I admittedly have nothing to compare them to. But in the world of dumplings, they left me wanting a little more. 

Kwati: 5/5 A thick, spiced bean stew served with a heaping portion of rice. Delicious and highly recommend. 

The food was out quickly and piping hot. $10 for a large portion of delicious, hearty food in the financial district is hard to beat. The menu is small, but there's something for meat eaters and veggies.
author: Daniele D.

description: I had a Nepalito and a mango lassi. The mango lassi was great! That said, I've never had a mango lassi I didn't like, so I suspect my bar for mango lassi quality is pretty low :p I did not enjoy the Nepalito as much because it had wayy to much rice.
author: Maddie D.

description: I had veggie Momos (dumplings) here and it taste like authentic. Sauce with Momos is delicious and must go place. I will try chicken/meat items next time.
author: Ashwani K.

description: I was in the neighborhood downtown and saw this spot.  I recalled hearing about them and decided to give them a try.  I just had the Momos.  Wow!  Amazing.  I love dumplings and these did not disappoint.  Very good and the sauce too was amazing.  I love Momos and love Binis.  This goes on my list of favorite dumpling places.
author: Daniel P.

description: Excellent Nepali food at a very reasonable price served by very friendly people.  Vegie dumplings are my favorite but everything is very good.
author: K S.

description: I love Nepalese food and was really excited when I found this spot. The service was quick - No lines. I ordered the vegetarian Combo which came with Rice, Vegetarian Momos and the Chili. The Chili was amazing. It was perfectly seasoned oozing with flavor. The Momos were little on a thicker side with little to no flavor. The Rice was super dry and also lacked seasoning. I would give it 3.5 stars.
author: Anu B.

description: I've loved Bini's Kitchen's for years and am so excited that Bini has opened a new restaurant right in downtown San Francisco so I won't have to wait for Off the Grid! The hot Momos (Nepalese pork, turkey or veggie dumplings with a delicious tomato-cilantro spicy sauce) have become one of my favorite meals. The Nepalese Chili (vegetarian), rice, and chicken dishes are to die for! The Chai is the perfect sweet and spicy warm drink to keep you cozy in our foggy San Francisco and the Mango Lassi is sweet and refreshing.  The combination of spices, fresh ingredients and love put into creating these dishes really comes together at Bini's Kitchen! Next time you're downtown I definitely recommend you stop by and try some for yourself!
author: Maggy G.

description: The turkey momos are absolutely divine. I'd never had nepalese food before and now I'm super addicted! The sauce for the momos is absolutely perfect, too!
author: Tara R.

description: Satisfying vegetable dumplings! I went with some skepticism because the only sauce they offer has cilantro (which I hate), but the friendly cashier offered me a taste, reassuring me it wasn't too strong of a flavor. She was right. The taste was spicy but not overpowering. Will definitely eat here again soon.
author: Stephanie B.

description: We love to eat here for lunch all the time. It's lightning fast, the food is delicious (momo and curry combo is my favorite), and the staff is nice. I can't recommend it enough.
author: Matthew G.

description: My new go-to spot for lunch in the Union Square are. The veggie combo is both delicious and an amazing deal and I keep coming back for it.  The momo's are super tasty and the nepalese chili with the flavored rice always hits the spot.  A great, healthy lunch spot in the union square area.
author: Gaurav N.

description: The food is amazing. You should totally get the momos, or Nepalese dumplings from the heart of Kathmandu. Overall this place is the bomb in downtown.
author: Ashwin G.
